intro: Coffea lancifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved coffee, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to parts of Africa, including Kenya and Tanzania, and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves and small, white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its fruits are berries that contain two seeds, which are used to produce coffee. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, Coffea lancifolia is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
